revised_title: Agricultural Productivity and Crop Protection in the 1980s
tldr: This article discusses the importance of crop protection in increasing agricultural productivity during the 1980s. It highlights the use of physical, biological, and chemical control methods to prevent losses due to pests and improve efficiency. The author emphasizes the need for better post-harvest protection, wider use of chemicals, and more effective spray programs. The article also touches upon the challenges and potential of biological control methods, as well as the role of chemical control in crop protection.
